courses.title: JavaScript Essentials
courses.description: Learn the essentials of JavaScript programming.

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Introduction to JavaScript
chapters.description: This chapter introduces you to JavaScript, a versatile programming language used to create dynamic web content. You'll learn about its history and key features. The chapter will guide you through setting up your development environment. You'll write your first JavaScript program and understand its basic syntax. By the end, you'll be ready to dive deeper into the language.

chapters.title: Chapter 2: Variables and Data Types
chapters.description: Understanding variables and data types is crucial in JavaScript programming. This chapter explains how to declare variables using var, let, and const. You'll learn about different data types like strings, numbers, booleans, and objects. Practical examples will illustrate how to manipulate these data types. By the end, you'll be comfortable using variables and understanding their scope.

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Functions
chapters.description: Functions are fundamental building blocks in JavaScript. This chapter will teach you how to define and invoke functions. You'll explore different types of functions, including anonymous and arrow functions. The chapter covers parameters, return values, and scope. Practical examples will show how to use functions for modular and reusable code.

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Events
chapters.description: Events are key to creating interactive web pages. This chapter covers how to handle user actions like clicks, form submissions, and keyboard input. You'll learn about event listeners and event handlers. The chapter explains the event propagation model: capturing, bubbling, and delegation. By the end, you'll be able to create dynamic responses to user interactions.

chapters.title: Chapter 5: DOM Manipulation
chapters.description: The Document Object Model (DOM) is essential for web development. This chapter explains how to use JavaScript to access and manipulate HTML elements. You'll learn methods for selecting elements and modifying their content and attributes. The chapter covers adding and removing elements dynamically. Practical examples will demonstrate how to create interactive and responsive web pages.
